              [" or the actual width in pixels, like "],

              ["| The height of the virtual viewport of the device. Values2: "],

              [" or the actual width in pixels, like "],

              [" |"],
              ["initial-scale", [["c"]]],

                "| The initial zoom when the page is loaded. 1.0 does not zoom. |"

              ["| The minimum amount the visitor can zoom on the page. "],
              ["1.0", [["c"]]],
              [" does not zoom. |"],

              ["| The maximum amount the visitor can zoom on the page. "],
              ["1.0", [["c"]]],
              [" does not zoom. |"],
              ["user-scalable", [["c"]]],
              ["| Allows the device to zoom in and out. Values are "],
              ["yes", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],

              [
                ". If set to no, the user is not able to zoom in the webpage. The default is yes. Browser settings can ignore this rule. |"

          "last_edited_time": 1551948783364,
          "parent_id": "a309e13f-a41a-4bb8-b124-8dc3729bd43b",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["2 Similarly, the "],
              ["height", [["c"]]],
              [" property can be either specified in "],
              ["pixels", [["c"]]],
              [" ("],
              ["height=600", [["c"]]],
              [") or by "],
              ["device-height", [["c"]]],
              [" ("],
              ["height=device-height", [["c"]]],
              [
                ") which represents the physical height of the device’s screen."
              ]
            ]
          },

              ["In the above example, "],
              ["content=\"width=device-width", [["c"]]],
              [
                " means that the browser will render the width of the page at the width of its own screen. So if that screen is "
              ],
              ["480px wide", [["c"]]],
              [", the browser window will be "],
              ["480px wide", [["c"]]],
              [". "],
              ["initial-scale=1", [["c"]]],
              [
                " depicts that the initial zoom (which is 1 in this case, means it does not zoom)."
